publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2164 Rosie Kane: Glasgow Anti-War Action—That the Parliament supports Glasgow Anti-War Action which is embarking on a campaign of action across Scotland; congratulates the nine protesters who locked themselves onto three gates at BAE Systems complex in Edinburgh to highlight the fact that the company profits from war; deplores the fact that big business profits from misery and war; commends Glasgow Anti-War Action for having the courage to risk arrest in order to keep the public’s attention on the issue, and calls on MSPs to join Glasgow Anti-War Action in protest against the brutality taking place in Iraq.
S2M-2164 Glasgow Anti-War Action (lodged on 14 December 2004) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-2164 Glasgow Anti-War Action (lodged on 14 December 2004) Tommy Sheridan*

S2M-2164 Rosie Kane: Glasgow Anti-War Action—That the Parliament supports Glasgow Anti-War Action which is embarking on a campaign of action across Scotland; congratulates the nine protesters who locked themselves onto three gates at BAE Systems complex in Edinburgh to highlight the fact that the company profits from war; deplores the fact that big business profits from misery and war; commends Glasgow Anti-War Action for having the courage to risk arrest in order to keep the public’s attention on the issue, and calls on MSPs to join Glasgow Anti-War Action in protest against the brutality taking place in Iraq. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Tommy Sheridan
S2M-2164 Glasgow Anti-War Action (lodged on 14 December 2004) Elaine Smith*
